alternatives.transcript: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. I love a slow roasted or slow baked roast of pork. And for that, ideally, this is the pork butt, pork shoulder. As you see, there's a fair amount of fat in it, but it's very moist and tender and so forth. And what I want to do here to start with, you put salt and pepper on top of it. I will brown it. And... Top of it, and we'll brown it. And what I put here, little wedge of garlic like this. A little wedge of garlic, about 5 or 6 of those. And what you do, they are pointed, as you can see here. You make a hole in there to push them into that hole, To stud them like this. OK. Give taste. Again. There. 5 or 6. You can do that with a leg of lamb or with other thing, too, you know. That's it. And that, I'm going to put that to brown here. I don't need any fat in there. And it should brown A good 15, 20 minutes until it's nicely roasted all around. And after that, around I put what we call like a ratatouille in France. The ratatouille is a stew from the south of France. I'm going to Cut those very coarsely. Garlic, onion. OK. I have an eggplant close to 12 ounce. And a zucchini, about the same way too. Alright. And you can be Pretty coarse with that. 1 last tomato here. Okay. Okay. Cover. Okay. Cover. Okay. This is nicely browned all around. You can see. Okay. That's it. I'm going to put like half a teaspoon of herb de Provence or Italian seasoning, about the same thing. And all of my garnish there. And a little salt on those vegetables there. And that's basically it. 275 degrees in the oven, an hour and a half, 2 hours. I'll check it out. And that's it. Now, you can see it's very tender. Here it is here. Now they roast. Now you have all of those vegetables around the ratatouille. And remember, we didn't put any liquid in it. Just the natural liquid of the vegetable and the meat. Okay. I could cut my roast in the middle here. Still quite hot. Quite hot. We'll put it in my vegetable here at the end. A sprinkling of herb on top of it. And here it is, the shoulder of pork braised slowly with ratatouille around. Happy cooking.

paragraphs.transcript:
Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. I love a slow roasted or slow baked roast of pork. And for that, ideally, this is the pork butt, pork shoulder. As you see, there's a fair amount of fat in it, but it's very moist and tender and so forth. And what I want to do here to start with, you put salt and pepper on top of it.

I will brown it. And... Top of it, and we'll brown it. And what I put here, little wedge of garlic like this. A little wedge of garlic, about 5 or 6 of those.

And what you do, they are pointed, as you can see here. You make a hole in there to push them into that hole, To stud them like this. OK. Give taste. Again.

There. 5 or 6. You can do that with a leg of lamb or with other thing, too, you know. That's it. And that, I'm going to put that to brown here.

I don't need any fat in there. And it should brown A good 15, 20 minutes until it's nicely roasted all around. And after that, around I put what we call like a ratatouille in France. The ratatouille is a stew from the south of France. I'm going to Cut those very coarsely.

Garlic, onion. OK. I have an eggplant close to 12 ounce. And a zucchini, about the same way too. Alright.

And you can be Pretty coarse with that. 1 last tomato here. Okay. Okay. Cover.

Okay. Cover. Okay. This is nicely browned all around. You can see.

Okay. That's it. I'm going to put like half a teaspoon of herb de Provence or Italian seasoning, about the same thing. And all of my garnish there. And a little salt on those vegetables there.

And that's basically it. 275 degrees in the oven, an hour and a half, 2 hours. I'll check it out. And that's it. Now, you can see it's very tender.

Here it is here. Now they roast. Now you have all of those vegetables around the ratatouille. And remember, we didn't put any liquid in it. Just the natural liquid of the vegetable and the meat.

Okay. I could cut my roast in the middle here. Still quite hot. Quite hot. We'll put it in my vegetable here at the end.

A sprinkling of herb on top of it. And here it is, the shoulder of pork braised slowly with ratatouille around. Happy cooking.
